snippet: The governors said that a standoff in Washington could backfire on the party if it is seen as being responsible for bringing the government to a halt.
abstract: Republican governors, worried about potential impact on fragile economies in their states, warn their counterparts in Congress not to shut down federal government as part of effort to block financing for Pres Obama's health care law.
lead_paragraph: The governors said that a standoff in Washington could backfire on the party if it is seen as being responsible for bringing the government to a halt.

headline.main: G.O.P. Governors Warn Party Members in Congress Not to Shut Government
headline.print_headline: G.O.P. Governors Warn Party Members in Congress Not to Shut Government

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
